data.title: Celebrity picks for Derby Dead Pool 2017: G
data.text: Son of Colonel Gaddafi, and one of his henchmen. Captured in 2011. Now on trial.One half of the current oldest living co-joined twins, who have also done work in the entertainment business because of their unusual situation.Actor - made it big in 'The Singing Detective' and has been in the last 2 Harry Potter films as Dumbledore. Recently popped up in 'Doctor Who'.Qualified doctor, but became famous as one of 'The Goodies', and has been involved in broadcasting ever since the late 1960s.Former Chief Constable of Avon and Somerset, who was suspended in May 2014.Cartoonist. Illustrated the Barry McKenzie comics in 'Private Eye' and, despite his left-wing roots, was the first political cartoonist for the Daily Telegraph.Member of the Parliament for Harborough as well as a member of the Queen's Counsel and a former Guardian lawyer, along with other political positions.Flawed genius of the football field, who played for Newcastle United, Spurs, Lazio, Rangers and of course England, when he wasn't busy boozing and/or crying. On and off the wagon constantly.Italian actress, best known for playing Giulia Farnese in Borgia and for starring in the film The Rite.American-born nun, now resident in Rome who decided to vote in the 2008 US Presiential election, 52 years after the last time.Hollywood singer and dancer of the 1950s. Was the second musical guest on the night of The Beatles' debut appearance on 'The Ed Sullivan Show'.Actress, Sylvia Trench in James Bond - who was the girlfriend to Bond in the first two movies of the franchise.Canadian-born American architect, whose works are cited as being among the most important works of contemporary architecture in the 2010 World Architecture Survey, which led Vanity Fair to label him as "the most important architect of our age".Golfer, the first to hit a score of 59 in a PGA Tour. A different hole-in-one came when his colon was removed in 1980.Former Boomtown Rats front man turned shouty, sweary Live Aid and Live 8 organiser. Has been looking even rougher than usual of late, which certainly takes some doing.Star of 'Buck Rogers in the 25th Century'. Also got to flirt with Erin Gray, the lucky ol' dog.Norwegian-American physicist who shared the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1973 with Leo Esaki and Brian Josephson "for their discoveries regarding tunnelling phenomena in solids".West Indies cricketer, a stellar spinner in his prime who became the second player to take 300 wickets.Ex-model and actress. Played Kat Slater's mum in one of those 'EastEnders' flashback episodes and thus managed to get the fact she's dying of eye cancer on 'This Morning'. Born c. 1972.Actor, born in the US, but raised in Australia, where he found fame through the Mad Max films. Since then, he's been one of Hollywood's top actors. More recently has been directing bizarre films & insulting policemen.The only non-British member of the Monty Python team and director of a whole bunch of films that don't quite work.Football journalist, the doyen of the genre - has been in the industry since the early 1950's.American comic book artist. Was in the Navy during World War II, and consequentially many of his works are about wartime sailors. Died in July 2017 but no obit.Nobel Prize winning American theoretical physicist, who is the Metcalf Professor of Mathematics and Physics at Boston University and Higgins Professor of Physics, Emeritus, at Harvard University, and is a member of the Board of Sponsors for the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists.Irish actor who took up acting in his 30s but is now a regular on film and TV.English film director, film editor and author best known for his directorial and editing work on eight James Bond films from the 1960s to the 1980s.Film actor, has been in 'Hunt for Red October' and 'Silence of the Lambs'.1970s glam rocker who was jailed in 1999 for possession of hardcore child porn. "Do you wanna be in my gang?" Er...we'll give it a miss, thanks, Gary.Found of the firearms company Glock, who didn't start designing guns until he was well into his 50s. Well, it's something to do Actor best known for his role as the feckless George McFly in the 1980s classic 'Back to the Future'.Reknowned actor who's appeared on stage, screen and tv and is an aluminous of the 'Star Wars, 'James Bond' and 'Doctor Who' series.Despite her roles in countless kids' TV series, still best known for being the female team captain on 'Give Us A Clue' for years.Founder of payroll company Paychex, and was also a perennial governor candidate in New York until he left the state in protest of its high taxes (which, given he's a billionaire, means he'd have to give up a spare yacht). Now in cahoots with Monica Seles.Tennis player who, at the peak of his career, ranked No. 22 in singles. Now suffering from ALSThe starlet of 'The Wizards of Waverley Place' who, in a stunningly original move for Disney Channel actresses, then embarked on a pop career that involved her wearing very few clothes.Ballroom dancer, best known as a judge on Strictly Come Dancing and Dancing with the Stars. Known for shouting out "Seven" in a particularly strange way.Joined the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in 1952, rising steadily to become its General Secretary from 1985-91 and President of the USSR from 1990-91. Has a map of Italy tattooed on his head for some reason.Corpulent neuroscientist whose studies naturally focus on obesity. Formerly a comic actor and greeting card model. Well a man's gotta earn a wage Former American naval officer and aviator, chemist, test pilot, and NASA astronaut, best known as the command module pilot for Apollo 12.Gangly actor who turned down an offer to play professional basketball in order to go into films instead. Won an Oscar in 1982 for his part in 'An Officer and a Gentleman', and has gone on to play various tough guys and rough diamonds since.Indonesia man who claimed to be the oldest person ever recorded. Don't believe him for a second! Born December 31, 1870 (at least that's what he claims).Former manager of Crewe Alexandra FC, dragged into a sex abuse scandal involving one of his youth coaches in 2016.Best known for playing the henpecked Barry in 'Last of the Summer Wine'.Detective novelist, known for her alphabetical series of books ('A is for Alibi' etc).Actor, best known for his voice work on 'Thunderbirds' as Parker and Brains and on 'Doctor Who' as one of the voices of the Daleks.South Carolina senator who tried to run for US President against Trump but failed miserably. As they all did Travelling evangelist who has been preaching his doctrine of sin and salvation around the world for almost 60 years. Diagnosed with Parkinson's disease in 1992.Actor & comedian, best known as the lead role in 'Frasier', but also for his roles in 'Cheers' and 'The Simpsons' (as the voice of Sideshow Bob). Suffered a heart-attack in 2008.Modernist and one of Britain's leading product designers. Responsible for the looks of the Kodak Instamatic, the Intercity 125 train and the first UK parking meters, among others.Footballer with Stafford Rangers now fighting cancer. Oh no, another one of those picks!Best known for his portrayal of 'Dirty' Den Watts in Eastenders from the shows beginning in 1985 to 1989, his character seemingly killed off. He briefly returned from the dead in 2003 before leaving again in 2005 following an online sex scandal.American film actress known for her comic roles, and later as a villainess. She is best known for her roles in Columbia Pictures comedy shorts and Republic Pictures serials. Died in April 2017 but no obit.Legendary singer, songwriter and record producer, best known for recording a series of soul hit singles in the early 1970s, including 'Take Me to the River', 'Love and Happiness' and his signature song, 'Let's Stay Together'.Actor, best known as Oz in 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' and Scott Evil in the Austin Powers franchise.American neuroscientist best known for his work on the molecular and cellular function of neurons.Legendary ex-Manchester United & Northern Ireland goalkeeper who was a hero in the Munich Disaster, when he saved a number of people from death in the minutes after the plane crash.Former footballer for Rangers & Scotland, who is still with Rangers as a club director.Played the Master of Ceremonies in 'Cabaret' and came out of the closet (as if there was any need to) at the age of 82.American rock musician, multi-instrumentalist, singer, songwriter, director and producer best known as the former drummer for the grunge band Nirvana and the founder and frontman of the rock band Foo Fighters.Former SS guard at Auschwitz, found guilty in court some 70 years later. Though an outspoken critic of Holocaust denial, this in turn made him unusually open about his Nazi past, which made him easier to prosecute!Trap rapper with 14 albums and 10 arrests since 2005. Has an ice cream cone tattooed on his face.Actor, better known in the US, though he has starred in many international movie hits, including 'The Lion King'.Actor and singer, mostly appearing on the Broadway stage who made his Broadway debut in 'Baker Street' in 1965.His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama. According to our contributor, he's a nice guy, you'd want him for a grandfather, and he is both the head of state and the spiritual leader of Tibet.
